intro: Gymnocarpos decander f. salsoloides, commonly known as the sand mat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with small, fleshy leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in summer, followed by small, dry fruits containing seeds. It is adapted to harsh environments, exhibiting drought tolerance and efficient water use. Its ecological role includes stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for small animals and insects.
